0.name: The Sands of Time
desc: "   The sands of the desert span out to the north.  The landscape is completely
barren except for the occasional cactus growing out from the sands.  Dust balls
swim freely across the top of the desert as though they have someplace to go.
The only wildlife visible is a random scorpion or lizard skittering out from
beneath a rock to see who is invading their territory.  Two large slabs of stone
jut out from the sand in the distance to the north.

1.name: The Sands of Time
desc: "   The sands of the desert continue in every direction.  The landscape is
completely barren except for the occasional cactus growing out from the sands.
The sky seems to glow with a multi-colored light, ribbons of color float and
twist in the air.  Dust balls swim freely across the top of the desert as
though they have someplace to go.  The only wildlife visible is the random
scorpion or lizard skittering out from beneath a rock to see who is invading
their territory.  Two large slabs of stone jut out from the sand in the
distance to the north.

2.name: The Sands of Time
desc: "   The sands of the desert continue to the north and east.  The landscape is
completely barren except for the occasional cactus growing out from the sands.
The sky seems to glow with a multi-colored light, ribbons of color float and
twist in the air.  Dust balls swim freely across the top of the desert as
though they have someplace to go.  The only wildlife visible is the random
scorpion or lizard skittering out from beneath a rock to see who is invading
their territory.  Two large slabs of stone jut out from the sand in the
distance to the northeast.

3.name: The Sands of Time
desc: "   The sands of the desert continue to the north and west.  The landscape is
completely barren except for the occasional cactus growing out from the sands.
The sky seems to glow with a multi-colored light, ribbons of color float and
twist in the air.  Dust balls swim freely across the top of the desert as
though they have someplace to go.  The only wildlife visible is the random
scorpion or lizard skittering out from beneath a rock to see who is invading
their territory.  Two large slaps of stone jut out from the sand in the
distance to the northwest.

desc: "   The sands of the desert continue in every direction.  The landscape is

desc: "   The sands of the desert continue in every direction.  The landscape is

6.name: The Sands of Time
desc: "   The sands of the desert continue in every direction.  The landscape is
completely barren except for the occasional cactus growing out from the sands.
The sky seems to glow with a multi-colored light, ribbons of color float and
twist in the air.  Dust balls swim freely across the top of the desert as
though they have someplace to go.  The only wildlife visible is the random
scorpion or lizard skittering out from beneath a rock to see who is invading
their territory.  Two large slabs of stone jut out from the sand in the
distance to the northeast.

7.name: Before the Stone Doors
desc: "   Two large doors are built into huge stone slabs jutting out from the sand
to the north.  There are some hieroglyphics etched into the doors, most likely
informing the identities of the residents of the sarcophagus, or could it be
a warning?  A couple of men dressed in tan clothes and white safari hats are
vigorously debating the etchings, they do not seem to agree on eachothers
translations.

8.name: The Sands of Time
desc: "   Huge stone slabs jut out from the sand, blocking any further travel to the
north.  The sands of the desert continue to the east and south.  There is some
sort of commotion coming from the east.  A couple of men dressed in tan clothes
stand before a set of doors talking loudly.  The landscape of the desert is
completely barren except for the occasional cactus growing out from the sands.
The sky seems to glow with a multi-colored light, ribbons of color float and
twist in the air.  Dust balls swims freely across the top of the desert as
though they have someplace to go.  The only wildlife visible is the random
scorpion of lizard skittering out from beneath a rock to see who is invading
their territory.

9.name: The Sands of Time
desc: "   The sands of the desert continue to the west.  The landscape is completely
barren except for the occasional cactus growing out from the sands.  The sky
seems to glow with a multi-colored light, ribbons of color float and twist in
the air.  Dust balls swim freely across the top of the desert as though they
have someplace to go.  The only wildlife visible is the random scorpion or
lizard skittering out from beneath a rock to see who is invading their
territory.  The two large slabs jutting out from the ground to the northeast
seem to be the feet of a gigantic sarcophagus!  What could be in there?

10.name: The Sands of Time
desc: "   Huge stone slabs jut out from the sand, blocking any further travel to the
north.  The sands of the desert continue to the west and south.  There is some
sort of commotion coming from the west.  A couple of men dressed in tan clothes
stand before a set of doors talking loudly.  The landscape of the desert is
completely barren except for the occasional cactus growing out from the sands.
The sky seems to glow with a multi-colored light, ribbons of color float and

though they have someplace to go.  The only wildlife visible is the random
scorpion of lizard skittering out from beneath a rock to see who is invading
their territory.

11.name: The Sands of Time
desc: "   The sands of the desert continue to the west.  The landscape is completely
barren except for the occasional cactus growing out from the sands.  The sky
seems to glow with a multi-colored light, ribbons of color float and twist in
the air.  Dust balls swim freely across the top of the desert as though they
have someplace to go.  The only wildlife visible is the random scorpion or
lizard skittering out from beneath a rock to see who is invading their
territory.  The two large slabs jutting out from the ground to the northwest
seem to be the feet of a gigantic sarcophagus!  What could be in there?

12.name: Hallway Through the Catacombs
desc: "   Two large stone doors block any further travel to the south.  The hallway
through the crypt continues to the north.  The walls of the crypt are covered
with beautiful and intricately etched hieroglyphics.  The artwork has faded
with time, but some of the designs are still decipherable.  If only you
understood ancient languages!

13.name: Hallway Through the Catacombs
desc: "   The long stone hallway continues to the north and south.  The walls of the
crypt are covered with beautiful and intricately etched hieroglyphics.  The
artwork has faded with time, but some of the designs are still decipherable.
The markings seem to be telling the tale of the pharaoh and his followers.
The skull and cross-bones at the end of some of the sentences is probably not
a good sign.  If only you understood ancient languages!

14.name: Hallway Through the Catacombs
desc: "   The long stone hallways continue in every direction.  The walls of the
crypt are covered with beautiful and intricately etched hieroglyphics.  The
artwork has faded with time, but some of the designs are still decipherable.
The markings seem to be telling the tale of the pharaoh and his followes.
There is a bright, bold colored skull and cross-bones at the end of some of
the sentences, probably not a good sign.  If only you understood ancient
languages!

15.name: Hallway Through the Catacombs
desc: "   The long stone hallway opens up to the west.  The walls of the crypt are
covered with beautiful and intricately etched hieroglyphics.  The artwork
has faded with time, but some of the designs are still decipherable.  The
markings seem to be telling the tale of the pharaoh and his followers.  There
are skull and cross-bones markings at the end of some of the sentences,
probably not a good sign.  There seems to have been some type of cave-in to
the east.  A large pile of rocks and overturned, broken coffins block any
further traverl to the east.

16.name: Hallway Through the Catacombs
desc: "   The long stone hallway opens up to the east.  The walls of the crypt are
covered with beautiful and intricately etched hieroglyphics.  The artwork

22.name: Hallway Through the Catacombs
desc: "   The long stone hallways continue to the north, south and east.  The walls
of the crypt are covered with beautiful and intricately etched hieroglyphics.
The artwork has faded with time, but some of the designs are still decipherable.
The markings seem to be telling the tale of the pharaoh and his followers.
The skull and cross-bones at the end of some of the sentences is probably not
a good sign.  If only you understood ancient languages!  A low moan echoes in
from the hallways to the north and south, promptly followed by the human screams.
What is going on in here?

23.name: Hallway Through the Catacombs

31.name: Hallway Through the Catacombs
desc: "   The long stone hallway continues to the north and south.  The walls of the
crypt are covered with beautiful and intricately etched hieroglyphics.  The
artwork has faded with time, but some of the designs are still decipherable.
The markings seem to be telling the tale of the pharaoh and his followers.
The skull and cross-bones at the end of some of the sentences is probably not
a good sign.  If only you understood ancient languages!

32.name: Hallway Through the Catacombs
desc: "   The long stone hallways continues in every direction.  The walls of the
crypt are covered with beautiful and intricately etched hieroglyphics.  The
artwork has faded with time, but some of the designs are still decipherable.
The markings seem to be telling the tale of the pharaoh and his followes.
There is a bright, bold colored skull and cross-bones at the end of some of
the sentences, probably not a good sign.  If only you understood ancient
languages!

33.name: Hallway Through the Catacombs
desc: "   The long stone hallway opens up to the west.  It appears there was some
sort of cave-in, as a pile of rocks and debris blocks any further travel
to the east.  A long, white tweed rope sways down from a small hole in the
ceiling of the catacombs.  Could someone have come in this way?  A quick
and brief flash of movement in the shadows reveals that you are not alone.

34.name: Hallway Through the Catacombs
desc: "   The long stone hallway opens up to the east.  The walls of the crypt are
covered with beautiful and intricately etched hieroglyphics.  The artwork
has faded with time, but some of the designs are still decipherable.  The
markings seem to be telling the tale of the pharaoh and his followers.  There
are skull and cross-bones markings at the end of some of the sentences,
probably not a good sign.  There seems to have been some type of cave-in to
the west.  A large pile of rocks and overturned, broken coffins block any
further travel to the west.

35.name: Hallway Through the Catacombs
desc: "   The long stone hallway opens up to the south.  The walls of the crypt are
covered with beautiful and intricately etched hieroglyphics.  The artwork
has faded with time, but some of the designs are still decipherable.  The
markings seem to be telling the tale of the pharaoh and his followers.  The
skull and cross_bones markings at the end of some of the sentences are
probably not a good sign.  If only you understood ancient languages.  There
is a large scarab etched into the floor of the room.  A slit with metal handles
on each side runs down the center of the artwork.  It looks like the scarab
might be able to be opened.

36.name: Hallway Through the Catacombs
desc: "   The stone hallways continue to the northeast and northwest.  There is a
small staircase leading up to a large scarab sketched into the ceiling.  A long
slit with two metal handles on each side makes it appear as though this is
some kind of door.  The doors could probably be opened to access the catacombs
above.  The hallways are lit with torches attached to the walls every few feet.

37.name: Hallway Through the Catacombs
desc: "   The stone hallways continue to the southeast and northwest.  The hallways
are lit with flaming torches attached to the walls every few feet.  The sounds
of slow, dragging foot steps can be heard echoing in from the hallways in the
distance.  What could be down here?

38.name: Hallway Through the Catacombs
desc: "   The stone hallways continue to the northeast and southeast.  The hallways
are lit with flaming torches attached to the walls every few feet.  The sounds
of slow, dragging foot steps can be heard echoing in from the hallways in the
distance.  What could be down here?

39.name: Hallway Through the Catacombs
desc: "   The stone hallways continue to the northeast and southwest.  The hallways
are lit with flaming torches attached to the walls every few feet.  The sounds
of slow, dragging foot steps can be heard echoing in from the hallways in the
distance.  What could be down here?

40.name: Hallway Through the Catacombs
desc: "   The stone hallways continue to the north, southeast and southwest.  The
hallways are lit with flaming torches attached to the walls every few feet.
Low, unearthly moans can be heard to the north.  The sounds of slow, dragging
foot steps can be heard echoing in from the hallways in the distance.

41.name: Hallway Through the Catacombs
desc: "   The stone hallways continue to the southeast and northwest.  The hallways
are lit with flaming torches attached to the walls every few feet.  The sounds
of slow, dragging foot steps can be heard echoing in from the hallways in the
distance.  What could be down here?

42.name: Hallway Through the Catacombs
desc: "   The stone hallways continue to the northwest and southwest.  The hallways
are lit with flaming torches attached to the walls every few feet.  The sounds
of slow, dragging foot steps can be heard echoing in from the hallways in the
distance.  What could be down here?

43.name: Hallway Through the Catacombs
desc: "   The stone hallways continue to the northeast and southwest.  The hallways
are lit with flaming torches attached to the walls every few feet.  The sounds
of slow, dragging foot steps can be heard echoing in from the hallways in the
distance.  What could be down here?

44.name: Hallway Through the Catacombs
desc: "   The stone hallways continue in every direction.  The hallways are lit with
flaming torches attached to the walls every few feet.  Loud moans and screams
can be heard coming from the rooms to the east and west.  The sounds of slow,
dragging foot steps can be heard echoing in from the hallways in the distance.
It sounds like they are closing in on you.

45.name: A Simple Burial Chamber
desc: "   The chamber is filled expensive carpets and tapestries from the pharaoh's
kingdom.  The tapestries hang beautifully from the walls, displaying their
intricate patterns and colors.  The carpets lines the floor like a glorious
field of plush multi-colored grass.  There are coffins over-turned all over
the chamber.  It looks like someone has already ransacked this room for all
of its treasures.

46.name: A Simple Burial Chamber
desc: "   The chamber is filled expensive carpets and tapestries from the pharaoh's
kingdom.  The tapestries hang beautifully from the walls, displaying their
intricate patterns and colors.  The carpets lines the floor like a glorious
field of plush multi-colored grass.  There are coffins over-turned all over
the chamber.  It looks like someone has already ransacked this room for all
of its treasures.

47.name: Hallway Through the Catacombs
desc: "   The stone hallways continue to the north and south.  The hallways are lit
with flaming torches attached to the walls every few feet.  Low and unearthly
moans can be heard to the north and south.  The sounds of slow, dragging foot
steps can be heard echoing in the the hallways in the distance.  It seems
like they are getting closer.

48.name: Hallway Through the Catacombs
desc: "   The stone hallways continue in every direction.  The hallways are lit with
flaming torches attached to the walls every few feet.  Loud moans and screams
can be heard coming from the rooms to the east and west.  The sounds of slow,
dragging foot steps can be heard echoing in from the hallways in the distance.
It sounds like they are closing in on you.

49.name: The Queen's Crypt
desc: "   A medium sized sarcophagus rests atop a large stone altar against the east
wall.  The top of the queen's final resting place is laced with gold and jewels
in the likeness of the former empress.  She must have been quite beautiful
during her reign with the pharaoh.  The room is full of paintings and artwork
that the queen must have collected during her lifetime.  The sarcophagus begins
to shake violently and falls to the ground, flipping the lid to the floor.  A
decaying and bandaged covered body begins to crawl from the coffin with a loud
and frightening scream.

50.name: The Prince's Crypt
desc: "   A small sarcophagus rests atop a large stone altar against the west wall.
The top of the prince's final resting place is laced with jewels and gold in
the likeness of the young man.  The floor of the room is littered with the
toys the prince must have played with while he was still alive.  It is strange
that they are scattered around, so though they were recently used.  The top
of the sarcophagus slowly slides open, letting a small moan escape into the
air.  A decrepit, rotting hand raises from the stone coffin and grasps the
air as though it was searching for something.  This is probably a good time
to go back into the hallways to the east.

51.name: Hallway Through the Catacombs
desc: "   The stone hallways continue to the north and south.  The hallways are lit
with flaming torches attached to the walls every few feet.  Low and unearthly
moans can be heard to the north and south.  The sounds of slow, dragging foot
steps can be heard echoing in the the hallways in the distance.  It seems
like they are getting closer.

52.name: The Royal Burial Chamber
desc: "   The royal burial chamber is huge and full of the pharaoh's fortune.  Piles
of gold and treasures sit in piles everywhere.  The walls are covered in
magnificent and colorful tapestries, bringing a beautiful glow off the
reflection of the gold.  Flaming torches sparkle every few feet on the walls
of the chamber.  A large stone sarcophagus rests atop a large altar against
the wall to the north.  This must be the final resting place of the pharaoh.

53.name: The Royal Burial Chamber
desc: "   The royal burial chamber is huge and full of the pharaoh's fortune.  Piles
of gold and treasures sit in piles everywhere.  The walls are covered in
magnificent and colorful tapestries, bringing a beautiful glow off the
reflection of the gold.  Flaming torches sparkle every few feet on the walls
of the chamber.  A large stone sarcophagus rests atop a large altar against
the wall to the northwest.  This must be the final resting place of the pharaoh.

54.name: The Royal Burial Chamber
desc: "   The royal burial chamber is huge and full of the pharaoh's fortune.  Piles
of gold and treasures sit in piles everywhere.  The walls are covered in
magnificent and colorful tapestries, bringing a beautiful glow off the
reflection of the gold.  Flaming torches sparkle every few feet on the walls
of the chamber.  A large stone sarcophagus rests atop a large altar against
the wall to the northeast.  This must be the final resting place of the pharaoh.

55.name: The Royal Burial Chamber
desc: "   A large stone sarcophagus rests atop a white marble altar against the wall
to the north.  The top of the pharaoh's final resting place is placed in gold
and jewels in the likeness of the once mighty ruler.  The visage is both
beautiful and frightening at the same time.  It was clear that this man ruled
his kingdom with a mighty hand.  The royal burial chamber opens up to the east,
west and south.  A hallway leading to the catacombs can be found to the far
south.

56.name: The Royal Burial Chamber
desc: "   The royal burial chamber is huge and full of the pharaoh's fortune.  Piles
of gold and treasures sit in piles everywhere.  The walls are covered in
magnificent and colorful tapestries, bringing a beautiful glow off the
reflection of the gold.  Flaming torches sparkle every few feet on the walls
of the chamber.  A large stone sarcophagus rests atop a large altar against
the wall to the west.  This must be the final resting place of the pharaoh.

57.name: The Royal Burial Chamber
desc: "   The royal burial chamber is huge and full of the pharaoh's fortune.  Piles
of gold and treasures sit in piles everywhere.  The walls are covered in
magnificent and colorful tapestries, bringing a beautiful glow off the
reflection of the gold.  Flaming torches sparkle every few feet on the walls
of the chamber.  A large stone sarcophagus rests atop a large altar against
the wall to the east.  This must be the final resting place of the pharaoh.

58.name: A Swirling Vortex of Energy
desc: "   A long column of energy swirls around you in a multi-colored hue.  It seems
to be directing you further along to the north.  There must be something
important in the distance to the north.  A large stone statue seems to be
blocking the way.  The enormous behemoth is holding a wooden sign that probably
needs to be read.  You can get back to the bounce room by touching the door
frame to the south.
"   This area is for levels 15 to 50.  Any and all explorers above this level
need to touch the door frame and go back to the bounce room.  There is no way
for you to access this area.  Please respect the pharaoh's wishes.
Stone Statue Inc.

59.name: A Swirling Vortex of Energy
desc: "   A long column of energy swirls around you in a multi-colored hue.  It seems
to be directing you further to the north.  There must be something important in
there.  You can get back to the bounce room by going to the south and touching
the door frame.

60.name: Entrance to Pharoah's Maze
desc: "   You are standing at the base of a spiral stone staircase. Above you a massive
sandstone looks like it will move if you try and push passed it, but has the look
of cunning craftsmanship that will prevent anyone entering from above.  A corridor
lined in perfectly fitted sandstone blocks leads north into darkness.

61.name: Pharoah's Maze
desc: "   You are standing in a corridor lined in perfectly fitted sandstone blocks.
Passages lead off south, east and west.
